Design of a Radio Frequency–Based Eye Movement Recognition System
Utilizing Medium Reflectivity

LIU Ying; WANG Yikai; HUO Chunguang; WANG Zhelun
Project

Abstract

This paper presents ES-Eyes, and an energy-sensing-based system for monitoring eye movements is designed to address interference from human movements and environmental noise in radar signals. The system uses a model to quantify object reflection intensity and accurately locate the face, and it tracks head movement intensity over time to extract eye movement data. By mapping radar velocity-time spectrograms to an eye movement model, it identifies key eye actions such as blinking and eye opening/closing. Experimental results show that ES-Eyes offers high accuracy with minimal errors in blink frequency, eye opening/closing duration, and positioning (93.2% accuracy). The system is lightweight, cost-effective, and suitable for use in daily work or driving environments, aiding in health and fatigue assessments.

Publication Chinese Journal of Sensors and Actuators
